usage_and_dosing.description: Quinupristin-dalfopristin is a streptogramin antibiotic with activity vs. Staphylococcus, Streptococcus species and other gram-positive organisms.
usage_and_dosing.note: Current FDA indication is for skin and skin structure infections due to MSSA or S. pyogenes.

adult_dose.skin_skin_structure_infection: 7.5 mg/kg IV q12h via central line

renal_adjustment.note: Dosage adjustment may be required in hepatic disease.
renal_adjustment.crcl_or_egfr: No dosage adjustment for renal impairment

hepatic_adjustment.note: PK data, but not clinical data, suggest the need for dosage adjustment. Use caution.

adverse_effects: Painful arthralgias in 2-50% of patients, also nausea, myalgias.

pregnancy_risk.lactation: Probably safe with monitoring, but no data available; avoid if possible.

pharmacology.peak_serum_conc: Quin 3.2, dalf 8 (7.5 mg/kg IV q8h, SS)
pharmacology.auc: Quin 7.2, dalf 10.6 (7.5 mg/kg IV q8h, 0-24 hr)

comments: Previous approval had included serious infections due to vancomycin-resistant isolates of Enterococcus faecium at a dose of 7.5 mg/kg q8h by central line.
Pristinamycin is a closely-related member of the streptogramin group of antibiotics with activity against Staph. aureus (including MRSA) and streptococcal species:
Available in some European countries; not available in the US.
Mixture of two components with a synergistic antibacterial activity.
Usual dose is 2-4 gm po/day in divided doses.
